intro: Arabis halleri subsp. vulgaris, commonly known as candytuft, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and is often found in meadows, gardens, and rocky areas.
